availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry J. Clark (Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer and 7th KY Inf USA pvt, corp, 1st sgt, capt)

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Clark and Tabitha Clark. Married to Emma R. Clark. Father of Martha E. Clark. Farmer in Jackson County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private, corporal, first sergeant, and captain from August 24, 1861, to October 5, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Kentucky, p. 301B.
